Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The ACLU-PA supports Senate Bill 14, and we need your help to ensure it passes. Join ACLU-PA Legislative Associate Marianne Stein and ACLU-PA Campaign for Smart Justice Organizer Alex Domingos on Wednesday, September 4 in State College to learn the most effective way to lobby your legislator.

Pennsylvania has the second highest percentage of its residents under community supervision in the country. Technical probation violations, such as missing a meeting with a probation officer, often lead individuals back to jail and fuel the system of mass incarceration. Under current Pennsylvania law, there are no limitations to the length of a probation sentence.

If enacted, Senate Bill 14 would:

  • Require early termination of supervised probation after a person has served 18 months of probation without violation or revocation;
  • Cap probation terms for felonies at 5 years;
  • Cap probation terms for misdemeanors at 3 years;
  • Ban courts from extending probation terms because a person failed to pay a fine, cost, or restitution, if the person is not financially able to pay such amounts;
  • Limit incarceration for technical violations of parole.
